column4: The Government of India approved a 12 percent increase in Minimum Support Price for Kharif crops for 2024-25.
The Ministry of Power launched the PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana aimed at providing free electricity up to 300 units for households with rooftop solar installations.
The Indian Cabinet approved the expansion of PM Kisan scheme benefits to include tenant farmers subject to state verification.
The Ministry of Agriculture released guidelines for climate-resilient crop varieties aimed at improving yield stability.
The government announced an incentive program for rural cold storage infrastructure under the Agriculture Infra Fund.
India signed an MoU with Nepal to strengthen cross-border energy trade including hydropower projects.
The Ministry of Electronics launched the IndiaAI Mission focusing on compute capacity and AI innovation.
The Ministry of Health launched a screening campaign for non-communicable diseases across 150 districts.
The government approved the National Logistics Policy to improve multimodal transport infrastructure.
The Ministry of Education introduced the National Research Fellowship for meritorious postgraduate students.
The Ministry of Rural Development expanded e-GramSwaraj for real-time Panchayat-level monitoring.
The Government announced updated procurement targets for wheat and paddy for the 2024-25 season.
The Ministry of Railways launched Vande Bharat sleeper prototype development.
The Union Cabinet approved the extension of PM Ujjwala Yojana subsidies for LPG cylinders.
The Ministry of Skill Development introduced the National Apprenticeship Tracker for transparent reporting.
India and Japan signed an agreement to enhance semiconductor supply chain cooperation.
The government approved financial assistance for micro-irrigation systems under PMKSY.
The Ministry of Power issued guidelines for states to adopt smart prepaid meters by 2026.
The Cabinet approved the establishment of three new medical colleges in underserved districts.
India launched the National Green Credit Program to promote sustainable practices.
The Home Ministry approved modern equipment procurement for disaster response forces.
The government launched a nationwide awareness drive on water conservation under Jal Shakti Abhiyan.
The Commerce Ministry released new export targets for the electronics sector for FY 2024-25.
The Union Cabinet approved viability gap funding for green hydrogen projects.
The Ministry of Agriculture launched a pilot program for soil health digital cards.
The government approved the construction of 2
column6: 000 rural houses under PM Awas Yojana.

column4: India announced revised emission standards for thermal power plants.
The Ministry of Women and Child Development launched early childhood nutrition guidelines.
India expanded BharatNet Phase III for last-mile rural fiber connectivity.
The Ministry of Defence commissioned a new indigenously developed radar system.
The Cabinet approved incentives for drone-assisted agriculture deployment.
The Ministry of Fisheries launched a scheme for modernizing fish landing centers.
India signed a technology transfer agreement for high-efficiency solar modules.
The government announced increased funding for Ayushman Bharat digital health infrastructure.
The Ministry of Education launched a teacher training program for digital pedagogy.
India approved a national framework for cybersecurity standards in critical sectors.
The Ministry of Agriculture issued advisories for pest-resistant seed varieties.
The government introduced guidelines for EV battery recycling and traceability.
India signed a climate financing cooperation agreement with the European Union.
The Ministry of MSME announced a grant program for rural manufacturing clusters.
The Finance Ministry notified GST exemptions for certain medical devices.
India expanded its digital payments infrastructure through NPCI partnerships.
The Ministry of Tourism launched a rural tourism promotion campaign.
The government announced incentives for biofuel production from agricultural waste.
India approved new data-sharing guidelines for public digital platforms.
The Ministry of Road Transport approved highway upgrades along key economic corridors.
India launched an entrepreneurship mentoring scheme for college students.
The Ministry of Power issued updated tariff guidelines for renewable energy generators.
The government introduced a nationwide farmer credit outreach program.
India approved a policy supporting the adoption of AI in agriculture.
The Ministry of Labour updated wage standards for industrial workers.
India signed agreements to enhance digital skilling for rural youth.
The Ministry of Railways approved 100 new Vande Bharat trains for 2025 rollout.
The Cabinet approved funding for 1200 MW solar power generation capacity.
India launched a satellite-based crop monitoring system for real-time yield estimation.
The Prime Minister paid tribute to the framers of India’s Constitution on Constitution Day.
CCRAS launched SIDDHI 2.0 to strengthen research-driven innovation in the Ayurveda pharmaceutical sector.
The Prime Minister wrote a letter to citizens on Constitution Day highlighting the importance of democratic values.
The Prime Minister shared glimpses of his visit to Kurukshetra.
PDUNASS hosted the 23rd session of Reimagining Governance: Discourse for Excellence.
CSIR-NIScPR and CSIR-NPL jointly organized a curtain raiser for India International Science Festival 2025.
The Union Health Minister stated that the World Cup-winning blind women cricketers are an inspiration for the nation.
The Prime Minister shared glimpses of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Mandir Dhwajarohan Utsav in Ayodhya.
The film ‘Bindusagar’ reflected the full circle of life at the 56th International Film Festival of India.
National Milk Day 2025 celebrations were announced to take place in New Delhi.
IFFI
column6: and LTIMindtree launched India’s first AI Film Festival.

column4: The Finance Minister chaired a review meeting with Regional Directorates and Registrar of Companies.
The Lok Sabha Speaker said connecting youth with democracy is the need of the hour.
The film ‘Vanya’ was showcased highlighting a story of love beyond words.
The Secretary of DFS chaired a review meeting on pending IBC cases at NCLT.
The Cinema AI Hackathon 2025 recognized excellence in AI-driven filmmaking at the 56th IFFI.
Chris Corbould discussed his SFX craft behind Bond and Batman films at IFFI.
Creative Minds of Tomorrow 2025 concluded showcasing India’s young creators.
The Union Minister Kiren Rijiju announced the return of Sacred Buddha Relics to India after exposition in Bhutan.
A collaborative publication titled ‘Rangoli: Roop
column6: Lay ki – Bhartiya Cinema ke Vihangam Shikhar Vyaktitva’ was launched by DPD and FTII Pune.
